eu.wauz.wauzcore.menu

Class TradeMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.wauz.wauzcore.menu.TradeMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WauzInventory

    public class TradeMenu
extends java.lang.Object
implements WauzInventory
    An inventory that can be used as menu or for other custom interaction mechanics. Lets two players trade witch each other.
    Author:
    Eddshine
    See Also:
    WauzPlayerTrade

    • Method Detail

      • getInventoryId

        public java.lang.String getInventoryId()
        Specified by:
        getInventoryId in interface WauzInventory
        Returns:
        The id of the inventory.

      • open

        public static void open(org.bukkit.entity.Player requestingPlayer,
                        org.bukkit.entity.Player requestedPlayer)
        Opens the menu for the given players. The players can put items on their side of the window. If one player is ready items cannot be changed anymore. If both players are ready the items will be traded. When cancel is clicked, both receive their items back.
        Parameters:
        requestingPlayer - The player on the left side of the trade menu.
        requestedPlayer - The player on the right side of the trade menu.
        See Also:
        setMenuInventory(Inventory), setReadyStatus(boolean, boolean), MenuUtils.setBorders(Inventory)

      • setMenuInventory

        public void setMenuInventory(org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory menu)
        Sets the inventory for the trade menu.
        Parameters:
        menu - The new trade menu inventory.

      • selectMenuPoint

        public void selectMenuPoint(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryClickEvent event)
        Checks if an event in this inventory was triggered by a player click. The default event will be automatically canceled. Players can move items in their own inventories and on their menu side. The ready status can be changed or the trade can be cancelled.
        Specified by:
        selectMenuPoint in interface WauzInventory
        Parameters:
        event - The inventory click event.
        See Also:
        setReadyStatus(boolean, boolean)

      • destroyInventory

        public void destroyInventory(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryCloseEvent event)
        Cleans up everything, so the inventory can be closed. The player's will be notified, that the trade ended and will receive their items.
        Specified by:
        destroyInventory in interface WauzInventory
        Parameters:
        event - The inventory close event.
        See Also:
        handOutItems(boolean)

      • setReadyStatus

        public void setReadyStatus(boolean leftSide,
                           boolean isReady)
        Sets the ready status of one side of the trade menu. When both players are ready the trade will be executed.
        Parameters:
        leftSide - If the status of the left side should be set. Else it will be the right side.
        isReady - If the given side is ready.
        See Also:
        handOutItems(boolean)

      • handOutItems

        private void handOutItems(boolean ownItemsBack)
        Hands out the traded items to the players.
        Parameters:
        ownItemsBack - If the players should receive their own items back, instead of the traded ones.
        See Also:
        fillItemList(List, List), LootContainer.open(Player, List)

      • fillItemList

        private void fillItemList(java.util.List<org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack> itemList,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> itemIndexes)
        Fills the given list with the item stacks from the given menu slots.
        Parameters:
        itemList - The list that should be filled.
        itemIndexes - The indexes of the menu slots.
